<<<code>>>: $CODE

Question: add additional parameters to foreach loop: :I have a foreach loop that goesboolean doesWordMatch = false;for(Character[] charArr : charSets){  if(doesWordMatch)    //dosomething  else    break;}I was wondering, is there anyway to put the condition into the for loop? e.g.for(Character[] charArr : charSets && doesWordMatch == true){  //dosomething}edit-- Right, so would this be possible in a while loop? :o
Please using this api: Iterator.next.
Answer:
response:
Please answer my code questions using the given API following this format: <<<api>>>: $API
<<<code>>>: $CODE
<<<explanation>>>: $EXPLANATION.
Question: add additional parameters to foreach loop: :I have a foreach loop that goesboolean doesWordMatch = false;for(Character[] charArr : charSets){  if(doesWordMatch)    //dosomething  else    break;}I was wondering, is there anyway to put the condition into the for loop? e.g.for(Character[] charArr : charSets && doesWordMatch == true){  //dosomething}edit-- Right, so would this be possible in a while loop? :o
Please using this api: Iterator.next.
Answer: <<<api>>>: $API
<<<code>>>: $CODE
<<<explanation>>>: $EXPLANATION

API: Iterator.next
CODE: 

Iterator<Character[]> iterator = charSets.iterator();
while(iterator.hasNext() && doesWordMatch){
    Character[] charArr = iterator.next();
    //dosomething
}

EXPLANATION: The code above uses the Iterator.next method to iterate over the charSets. The condition in the while loop checks if the Iterator has more elements and if doesWordMatch is true. If both conditions are true, it continues to the next iteration. If either condition is false, it breaks out of the loop.

This way, you can add the condition to the while loop and it will stop iterating when the condition is no longer true.

Note: The condition in the while loop is evaluated before the body of the loop is executed. If the condition is false, the body of the loop is not executed.

This is a common way to add conditions to loops in Java.
